stem: A client on Sertraline (SSRI) for depression was recently prescribed Linezolid. He presents at 1400 with a temperature of 101.8Â°F, agitation, shivering, and hyperreflexia (+4 patellar reflexes). Complete the bowtie to guide management.

actions.text: Increase the dose of Sertraline to stabilize mood

rationale.correct: Serotonin Syndrome results from excessive serotonin activity in the central nervous system. Combining serotonergic agents like SSRIs (Sertraline) and MAOIs (Linezolid possesses MAOI activity) increases serotonin levels. This leads to hyperstimulation of 5-HT1A and 5-HT2 receptors. Clinical manifestations include altered mental status (agitation), autonomic dysfunction (hyperthermia, diaphoresis, tachycardia), and neuromuscular abnormalities (hyperreflexia, clonus). Immediate discontinuation of serotonergic medications is crucial to halt further serotonin accumulation. Benzodiazepines are administered to manage agitation, muscle rigidity, and hyperthermia. Continuous monitoring of vital signs and neurological status (deep tendon reflexes, clonus) is essential to assess treatment effectiveness and detect complications.
rationale.incorrect: Dantrolene is a muscle relaxant used primarily for Malignant Hyperthermia and Neuroleptic Malignant Syndrome (NMS), not Serotonin Syndrome. Increasing the SSRI dose would exacerbate the condition and potentially lead to fatal complications. While CK levels may be elevated due to muscle activity, monitoring deep tendon reflexes and clonus provides more specific and immediate information about the severity of serotonin excess. Lithium levels are irrelevant in this clinical context.
clinicalPearls: Ocular clonus (sustained, rhythmic eye movements) is a highly specific sign of Serotonin Syndrome.
Mild Serotonin Syndrome may resolve with discontinuation of the offending agent and supportive care.
Severe Serotonin Syndrome can lead to rhabdomyolysis, renal failure, and death if not promptly treated.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Serotonin Syndrome is characterized by hyperreflexia and clonus, while NMS presents with lead-pipe rigidity and hyporeflexia. Remember 'Serotonin = Super Reflexes' and 'NMS = No Movement Strength'.

mnemonic.title: SHIVERS
mnemonic.expansion:
S = Shivering
H = Hyperreflexia and Myoclonus
I = Increased Temperature
V = Vital Sign Instability (tachycardia, tachypnea, hypertension)
E = Encephalopathy (altered mental status, agitation)
R = Restlessness
S = Sweating (diaphoresis)

Key Actions: Discontinue all serotonergic medications immediately; Administer IV Benzodiazepines (Diazepam)
Key Monitoring: Vital signs (BP/HR/Temp); Deep Tendon Reflexes and Clonus

reviewUnits.heading: Serotonin Syndrome â€” Pathophysiology & Recognition
reviewUnits.body: Serotonin Syndrome results from excessive serotonin activity in the central nervous system, often due to combining serotonergic agents. Signs include altered mental status, autonomic dysfunction (hyperthermia, diaphoresis, tachycardia), and neuromuscular abnormalities (hyperreflexia, clonus). Ocular clonus is a highly specific sign.

reviewUnits.body: Serotonin Syndrome is characterized by hyperreflexia and clonus, while NMS presents with lead-pipe rigidity and hyporeflexia. Remember 'Serotonin = Super Reflexes' and 'NMS = No Movement Strength'.

reviewUnits.heading: Priority Interventions for Serotonin Syndrome
reviewUnits.body: The priority nursing interventions are: Discontinue all serotonergic medications immediately; Administer IV Benzodiazepines (Diazepam). Monitor: Vital signs (BP/HR/Temp); Deep Tendon Reflexes and Clonus. Dantrolene is for Malignant Hyperthermia/NMS. Increasing the SSRI dose would be fatal. While CK can rise in any syndrome with muscle activity, it is not the primary monitoring parameter for serotonin syndrome stability unlike reflexes (clonus).
